constituent: defeat, bound up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisigStory: Above we have the condensed form of bound up, and below the familiar shellfish. Now imagine two oysters engaged in shell-to-shell combat, the one who is defeated being bound and gagged with seaweed, the victor towering triumphantly over it. The bound shellfish thus becomes the symbol for defeat.
koohiiStory1: Tied up, the shellfish had to accept defeat!
koohiiStory2: Defeat is defined by a shellfish in binds.
myStory: thua. con sò thua lòi miệng
readingExamples: 負う (お.う), 負かす (ま.かす), 負ける (ま.ける)
words: a discount, a prize, something additional, bonus, an extra, an exaggeration
to be burdened with, to carry on back or shoulder
victory or defeat, match, contest, game, bout
be burdened with, carry on back or shoulder
